reviews.review: Yikes. Filled with adveritsements, filler and a quite terrible story.

I think my brain was going to go into safe mode if this was any longer but  it was under 90 min so made it through.  Poorly written characters with lazy dialogue and "jokes" make up the Emoji Movie where there didn't seem to be a hint of actual creativity.  Just a feature length ad for various apps with old internet references tossed in.  I suppose it wasn't the outright atrocity I was worried it would be but it is also worse than the "meh" I was hoping for.  Felt in a constant state of mild irritation but survived without wanting to shut this thing off to protect my sanity so I guess it can't be bottom of the barrel bad right?
Best movie ever made, 100 emoji out of 10 as Jack says
Not nearly as bad as people said, can be a fun children's movie.
If I could give negative stars, I would

This cinematic masterpiece, is the most spectacular adaptation of the modern age in film. The character development in this film, is awe-inspiring. The protagonist of this film, Gene, is the most three dimensional character : no, person, that I've been lucky enough to know over the 86 minutes of this film. The other characters of this movie, Hi-5, Jailbreak, Poop, Smiler, and the many other inspirations in this film, have changed my perception of the modern era. All in all, this cinematic masterpiece is a film to be remembered, and passed on throughout the future generations.
This was an amazing movie that was so inspiring and great!!!

There are movies so bad that you want to shoot it in the face for one of two reasons: 1) they are diseased and must be destroyed lest their infection spreads to unwitting viewers, or 2) they are actual evil and their destruction prevents the world from being a worse place. This is somewhere between those two; one on hand, you have voice actors like James Corden and Maya Rudolph actually *performing* to the best of their ability, making this movie's destruction a mercy killing for them. On the other hand, you have Sir Patrick Stewart willingly playing a shit emoji, meaning he willingly walked into a recording studio and read $h!t emoji lines, cashed a paycheck with the words "$h!t Emoji" in the Memo line, and then bought some $h!t with his $h!t emoji cash. It's not quite on the level of buying conflict diamonds, but it sure feels close.
Can we please make the the Tomatometer at 0% and the Audience Score at 0% liked it. PLEASE!
Very funny movie and for all ages!!!! Hilarious!
